description: There is no sound of desktop notifications nor notifications themselves, despite the provided permissions. No system tray icon.
Great Thing. Great to have the Discord feeling in matrix
Everytime I try to run the program it just crashes

Cinny is great - it offers fun and simple functions such as an easy way to add stickers/emojis.
It is stable, and polished.
I really recommend it.
summary: One of the best Matrix-clients out there

description: More stable than Fractal and supports more features, 10/10 would recommend

the current (gnome platform) flatpak runtime used is 42 which is no longer supported
please update the runtime to a supported version as using an EOL runtime is HUGE security risk
summary: cinny is awesome but please update the flatpak runtime

description: Although I like the interface, it uses runtime 42 which is EOL. This is disappointing in an otherwise stellar app.
summary: I like the interface, unfortunately it uses runtim 42

description: This wrapper has some issues, namely that it doesn't send notifications from the current conversation because I guess it doesn't give the equivilent to a tab switch event.
summary: App is good, this wrapper isn't

description:
It's one of my favorite Matrix clients available, it's got a great layout and a very intuitive interface. Here's the issues though:
* Flatpak doesn't match dark gtk theme (although the app theme can be changed in settings the bar and clear color remain white).
* Notifications don't work (at least with the flatpak on GNOME)
* Pasting images from the clipboard doesn't work (at least with the flatpak on GNOME)
It'd still recommend using Cinny, as it's one of the best looking, well layed out clients with a lot of nice features (like custom emojis).
summary: Great layout, a few issues though

description:
I like the app:

1. It supports URL Previews for both normal and E2EE Rooms/DMs
2. It's Web App Interface is *PERFECT* for using on a phone, the 3 display layout options also really help

Its Just needs to fix it's audio notification issue so that audio notifications will work on both Linux client and Android
